text: So we're now at the end of part 6 and I hope you've sort of started to see now how we're finally starting to develop various strategies around various principles that we're developing within the volume profiling course. Some of the questions I need you to check over and I need you to make sure you understand before moving on to your playbook or as follows. How often do markets bracket and how often do they trend? Again, rough estimation. It's not an exact percentage. It's going to vary based on the time, the fundamentals in the market, but roughly how often are we bracketing and how often are we trending. define and interpret the three ways the markets tend to form turning points. Again, crucial, remember those three turning points. I'll give you a little hint, you know, momentum loss and a little bit of excess and tail, those are the kind of things you want to think about when And then, what is volume and what is volatility and why do they impact the strategy creation. So crucial you understand that and so crucial you add the two elements of volume and volatility And then last, well, fourthly, you know, list of four types of market opens, again crucial. The way the market opens shows us either early conviction, which is strong, or low conviction. And then lastly, last question, list the three types of trade locations and when you list them again think in your head, why are these trade locations important? All this kind of thinking is going to get you to start formulating strategies based on market generated information, fact based information as opposed to just looking at a chart and saying well this is a buy and this is a sell. Good luck with those concept checkers and we'll see you in the playbook section.
